segment.source: Planning to Deploy Windows Firewall with Advanced Security (Windows 10)
segment.target: Planning to Deploy Windows Firewall with Advanced Security (Windows 10)

segment.source: Planning to Deploy Windows Firewall with Advanced Security
segment.target: Planning to Deploy Windows Firewall with Advanced Security

segment.source: Planning to Deploy Windows Firewall with Advanced Security
segment.target: Planning to Deploy Windows Firewall with Advanced Security

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: After you collect information about your environment and decide on a design by following the guidance in the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Design Guide, you can begin to plan the deployment of your design.
segment.target: After you collect information about your environment and decide on a design by following the guidance in the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Design Guide, you can begin to plan the deployment of your design.

segment.source: With the completed design and the information in this topic, you can determine which tasks to perform to deploy Windows Firewall with Advanced Security in your organization.
segment.target: With the completed design and the information in this topic, you can determine which tasks to perform to deploy Windows Firewall with Advanced Security in your organization.

segment.source: Reviewing your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Design
segment.target: Reviewing your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Design

segment.source: If the design team that created the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security design for your organization is different from the deployment team that will implement it, make sure that the deployment team reviews the final design with the design team.
segment.target: If the design team that created the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security design for your organization is different from the deployment team that will implement it, make sure that the deployment team reviews the final design with the design team.

segment.source: Review the following points:
segment.target: Review the following points:

segment.source: The design team's strategy for determining how WMI and security group filters attached to the GPOs will determine which devices apply to which GPO.
segment.target: The design team's strategy for determining how WMI and security group filters attached to the GPOs will determine which devices apply to which GPO.

segment.source: The deployment team can refer to the following topics in the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Design Guide:
segment.target: The deployment team can refer to the following topics in the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Design Guide:

segment.source: Planning Isolation Groups for the Zones
segment.target: Planning Isolation Groups for the Zones

segment.source: Planning the GPOs
segment.target: Planning the GPOs

segment.source: Planning GPO Deployment
segment.target: Planning GPO Deployment

segment.source: The communication to be allowed between members of each of the zones in the isolated domain and devices that are not part of the isolated domain or members of the isolated domain's exemption list.
segment.target: The communication to be allowed between members of each of the zones in the isolated domain and devices that are not part of the isolated domain or members of the isolated domain's exemption list.

segment.source: The recommendation that domain controllers are exempted from IPsec authentication requirements.
segment.target: The recommendation that domain controllers are exempted from IPsec authentication requirements.

segment.source: If they are not exempt and authentication fails, then domain clients might not be able to receive Group Policy updates to the IPsec connection security rules from the domain controllers.
segment.target: If they are not exempt and authentication fails, then domain clients might not be able to receive Group Policy updates to the IPsec connection security rules from the domain controllers.

segment.source: The rationale for configuring all IPsec authentication rules to request, not require, authentication until the successful negotiation of IPsec has been confirmed.
segment.target: The rationale for configuring all IPsec authentication rules to request, not require, authentication until the successful negotiation of IPsec has been confirmed.

segment.source: If the rules are set to require authentication before confirming that authentication is working correctly, then communications between devices might fail.
segment.target: If the rules are set to require authentication before confirming that authentication is working correctly, then communications between devices might fail.

segment.source: If the rules are set to request authentication only, then an IPsec authentication failure results in fall-back-to-clear behavior, so communications can continue while the authentication failures are investigated.
segment.target: If the rules are set to request authentication only, then an IPsec authentication failure results in fall-back-to-clear behavior, so communications can continue while the authentication failures are investigated.

segment.source: The requirement that all devices that must communicate with each other share a common set of:
segment.target: The requirement that all devices that must communicate with each other share a common set of:

segment.source: Authentication methods
segment.target: Authentication methods

segment.source: Main mode key exchange algorithms
segment.target: Main mode key exchange algorithms

segment.source: Quick mode data integrity algorithms
segment.target: Quick mode data integrity algorithms

segment.source: If at least one set of each does not match between two devices, then the devices cannot successfully communicate.
segment.target: If at least one set of each does not match between two devices, then the devices cannot successfully communicate.

segment.source: After the design and deployment teams agree on these issues, they can proceed with the deployment of the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security design.
segment.target: After the design and deployment teams agree on these issues, they can proceed with the deployment of the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security design.

segment.source: For more information, see Implementing Your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Design Plan.
segment.target: For more information, see Implementing Your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Design Plan.
